model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I hung up some more lights and candles today.
That's lovely! I always feel so cozy and comfortable when you do that.
I know, and I love making the apartment feel like a warm and welcoming space for you.
You always go above and beyond, dear.
It's the little things that count, right?
Definitely. Speaking of little things, do you remember when you told me about catching the bus just in time a few months ago?
Oh yes, I remember. I was so relieved I didn't have to wait in the cold for the next one.
It's amazing how small moments like that can make such a big difference in our day, isn't it?
Absolutely. It's the small moments that make life worth living.
And speaking of living, you mentioned a while back how involved you are in the different ministries at church.
Yes, I'm so grateful for the community and support I've found there. It's helped me grow in my faith so much.
It's wonderful to see you so passionate and dedicated to something you believe in.
And I'm grateful for your support and encouragement in it all.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Appreciation for faith and church community', 'Related Summaries': 'Husband reflects on his Christian upbringing, baptism, and involvement in church ministries.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Husband: Well, I've been thinking a lot about my faith lately, and how grateful I am for the Christian upbringing I had. ### Wife: That's great, Honey. I know your faith is important to you. ### Husband: It really is. I remember being baptized when I was eight years old and how much that moment meant to me. And now, being involved in different ministries at church just feels like the right thing to do. ### Wife: I'm happy to see you so passionate about your faith. ### Husband: Yeah, and it's not just about what I believe but also about the community of believers I've found at church. ### Wife: It's always great to have a supportive group of people around you. ### Husband: Absolutely, and it reminds me of when I talked to you about spending time with my friend. Being around people you trust can be so comforting.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Importance of faith and community', 'Related Summaries': 'Husband emphasizes the importance of faith, community, and close relationships.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Husband: And it's funny because I think about the time I ran to catch the bus and how thankful I was just to make it on time. It's like that with faith and community as well. You don't want to miss out on it. ### Wife: I understand. It's moments like those that make you appreciate what you have. ### Husband: Exactly. And I'm grateful to have you by my side, supporting me in my faith journey. ### Wife: I'll always be here for you, Honey.' }
```
